title: kvkapiR
code: library(kvkapiR)

title: kvkapiR
text: access KvK API, need API key. can apply API key learn different KvK APIs KvK Developer Portal.

title: kvkapiR
text: need API key current session, use kvk_set_api_key() function. ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: sets key current R session. key lost restart R.
code: kvk_set_api_key(api_key = "your_api_key_here")

title: kvkapiR
text: want store API key permanently, use kvk_store_api_key() function. saves key .Renviron file, making persist across R sessions. update existing API key, set overwrite parameter TRUE: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: must restart R changes take effect. ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: use method can safely store API key system.
code: kvk_store_api_key(api_key = "your_api_key_here") kvk_store_api_key(api_key = "your_new_api_key", overwrite = TRUE)

title: kvkapiR
text: KvK provides test environment can experiment API using production. information available KvK documentation page. functions kvkapiR support testing mode via test_environment argument, set FALSE default. ü¶Ü Tip: test environment contains fictional data based characters Dutch comic magazine ‚ÄúDonald Duck‚Äù. Try searching names like ‚ÄúDonald‚Äù ‚ÄúDagobert‚Äù see API works sample data.

title: kvkapiR
text: kvk_search() function wrapper KvK Search API. automatically paginates results (1,000 records). examples demonstrating perform searches handle API responses.

what: Example 1: single variable, less then 1.000 records
title: kvkapiR
text: Lets search KvK registrations village Koudum. Since small village fewer 1.000 registered businesses (API limit), records retrieved one request.
code: koudum <- kvk_search(plaats = "Koudum") koudum #> # A tibble: 506 √ó 6 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam                     adres        type  links  #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>                    <list>       <chr> <list> #>  1 01036576  000007810083     Stichting Gemeenschapsc‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  2 60112891  000045511098     Corriente 't Kofjeh√∫ske  <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  3 92692966  000032358083     M. de Boer               <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  4 40005051  000021251479     Bogerman                 <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  5 30168016  000057781184     It F√ªgeln√™st             <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  6 58496505  000027833429     HFK Verhuur              <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #>  7 62724843  000031708129     De Klink Exploitatie B.‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #>  8 01123666  000040288196     Winterberging IJzendoorn <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #>  9 40001473  000000303062     De S√¢ndobbe              <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #> 10 01091668  000000678279     Multiservice Beheer en ‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #> # ‚Ñπ 496 more rows

what: Example 2: single variable, more then 1.000 records
title: kvkapiR
text: city Rotterdam significantly larger Koudum. Searching registrations Rotterdam return 1,000 records, exceeding API limit. happens, warning displayed:

what: Example 3: combining multiple search terms in variables
title: kvkapiR
text: can combine multiple search terms parameter refine search. API treats multiple words within parameter operation default.

title: kvkapiR
text: can combine multiple search criteria query. example, let‚Äôs search businesses Utrecht name contains snackbar hoek:

title: kvkapiR
text: possible search KvK registrations using specific address. , need postal code house number. example, business registrered adress?
code: secret_adress <- kvk_search(postcode = "2594BD", huisnummer = "10") secret_adress #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 6 #>   kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam    adres            type           links      #>   <chr>     <chr>            <chr>   <list>           <chr>          <list>     #> 1 57096317  000028603745     politie <named list [1]> nevenvestiging <list [2]>

title: kvkapiR
text: package abbility retrieve three types profielen API: basisprofiel vestigingsprofiel naamgeving examples use test invironment.
code: donald <- kvk_search(naam = "Donald", test_environment = TRUE) #> ‚Ñπ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned.

title: kvkapiR
code: kvk_get_basisprofiel(kvkNummer = donald$kvkNummer[1], test_environment = TRUE) #> ‚Ñπ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 11 #>   kvkNummer indNonMailing naam     formeleRegistratieda‚Ä¶¬π materieleRegistratie‚Ä¶¬≤ #>   <chr>     <chr>         <chr>    <chr>                  <chr>                  #> 1 68750110  Ja            Test BV‚Ä¶ 20170519               20170519               #> # ‚Ñπ abbreviated names: ¬π‚ÄãformeleRegistratiedatum, #> #   ¬≤‚ÄãmaterieleRegistratie$datumAanvang #> # ‚Ñπ 6 more variables: totaalWerkzamePersonen <int>, statutaireNaam <chr>, #> #   handelsnamen <list>, sbiActiviteiten <list>, links <list>, #> #   `_embedded` <list>

title: kvkapiR
text: kvkapiR package provides simple yet powerful interface searching KvK API R. built-authentication handling, test environment support, flexible query options, streamlines access Dutch business registration data. details, refer official KvK API documentation.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Coen Eisma. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Eisma C (2025). kvkapiR: R Wrapper Dutch Chamber Commerce API. R package version 0.0.0.9004, https://github.com/coeneisma/kvkapiR/, https://coeneisma.github.io/kvkapiR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {kvkapiR: An R Wrapper for the Dutch Chamber of Commerce API},   author = {Coen Eisma},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9004, https://github.com/coeneisma/kvkapiR/},   url = {https://coeneisma.github.io/kvkapiR/}, }

what: An R Wrapper for the Dutch Chamber of Commerce API
title: An R Wrapper for the Dutch Chamber of Commerce API
text: goal kvkapiR provide convenient R programming language interface Dutch Chamber Commerce (KvK) APIs. package built using httr2 package follows best practices wrapping APIs R, outlined httr2 documentation. simplifies authentication, request handling, response parsing interacting KvK API. Currently, package provides access following KvK APIs: KvK Search API KvK Basisprofiel API KvK Vestigingsprofiel API KvK Naamgeving API details can found developers website KvK.

title: An R Wrapper for the Dutch Chamber of Commerce API
text: can install development version kvkapiR GitHub : install latest development version:
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("coeneisma/kvkapiR") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("coeneisma/kvkapiR", ref = "development")

title: An R Wrapper for the Dutch Chamber of Commerce API
text: basic examples demonstrating use kvk_search() function retrieve KvK registrations: can also combine multiple search parameters: See vignette("kvkapiR") examples information usage package.
code: library(kvkapiR)  koudum <- kvk_search(plaats = "Koudum") koudum #> # A tibble: 506 √ó 6 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam                     adres        type  links  #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>                    <list>       <chr> <list> #>  1 01036576  000007810083     Stichting Gemeenschapsc‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  2 60112891  000045511098     Corriente 't Kofjeh√∫ske  <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  3 92692966  000032358083     M. de Boer               <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  4 40005051  000021251479     Bogerman                 <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  5 30168016  000057781184     It F√ªgeln√™st             <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  6 58496505  000027833429     HFK Verhuur              <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #>  7 62724843  000031708129     De Klink Exploitatie B.‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #>  8 01123666  000040288196     Winterberging IJzendoorn <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #>  9 40001473  000000303062     De S√¢ndobbe              <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #> 10 01091668  000000678279     Multiservice Beheer en ‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #> # ‚Ñπ 496 more rows library(kvkapiR)  rotterdam <- kvk_search(naam = "huisartsen", plaats = "Rotterdam") rotterdam #> # A tibble: 202 √ó 7 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam       adres        type  links  vervallenNaam #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>      <list>       <chr> <list> <chr>         #>  1 24475068  000009219072     Wijkprakt‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #>  2 81943938  000048204625     Jans Huis‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #>  3 24484189  000016351312     Sanitas H‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #>  4 24477358  000010787356     Van Schai‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #>  5 66346339  000034979034     Huisartse‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #>  6 62380281  000031391419     Huisartse‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #>  7 54446538  000024210382     Huisartse‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #>  8 24484189  000036373648     Sanitas H‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #>  9 85464007  000051508060     itj huisa‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #> 10 24476795  000010613765     Baggerman‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> <NA>          #> # ‚Ñπ 192 more rows

what: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
text: function retrieves basis profile given KvK number (kvkNummer) using KvK Basisprofiel API. Users can also request additional data, owner information, main establishment, locations specifying include parameter. function also supports test_environment argument. set TRUE, function query KvK test API environment, providing set fictitious test data.

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
code: kvk_get_basisprofiel(   kvkNummer,   geoData = FALSE,   include = NULL,   test_environment = FALSE )

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
text: kvkNummer string representing KvK number basis profile requested. geoData logical value indicating whether geo-data included response. Defaults FALSE. TRUE, response include geo-data. include character specifying additional data include. Possible values: "eigenaar" (owner), "hoofdvestiging" (main establishment), "vestigingen" (locations). Defaults NULL (basic profile ). test_environment logical value indicating whether use test environment (TRUE) production environment (FALSE). Defaults FALSE.

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
text: tibble containing retrieved basis profile. geoData = TRUE, returned tibble also include geographical information.

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
text: function retrieves data KvK Basisprofiel API. geoData = TRUE, geo-data (e.g., location data) included returned profile. include parameter allows users request additional details, ownership information business locations. Important: test_environment = TRUE, actual API key required. using test data KvK test environment.

what: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_naamgeving
title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_naamgeving
text: function retrieves name information (naamgeving) given KvK number (kvkNummer) using KvK Naamgevingen API. function also supports test_environment argument. set TRUE, function query KvK test API environment, providing set fictitious test data.

title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_naamgeving
code: kvk_get_naamgeving(kvkNummer, test_environment = FALSE)

title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_naamgeving
text: kvkNummer string representing KvK number name information requested. test_environment logical value indicating whether use test environment (TRUE) production environment (FALSE). Defaults FALSE.

title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_naamgeving
text: tibble containing retrieved name information.

title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_naamgeving
text: function retrieves data KvK Naamgevingen API. Important: test_environment = TRUE, actual API key required. using test data KvK test environment.

title: Retrieve the Naamgeving for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_naamgeving
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Retrieve naamgeving for a given KvK number naamgeving <- kvk_get_naamgeving(kvkNummer = "68750110")  # Retrieve naamgeving from the test environment naamgeving_test <- kvk_get_naamgeving(kvkNummer = "68750110", test_environment = TRUE) } # }

what: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number ‚Äî kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number ‚Äî kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
text: function retrieves establishment profile (vestigingsprofiel) given establishment number (vestigingsnummer) using KvK Vestigingsprofiel API. function also supports test_environment argument. set TRUE, function query KvK test API environment, providing set fictitious test data.

title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number ‚Äî kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
code: kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(   vestigingsnummer,   geoData = FALSE,   test_environment = FALSE )

title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number ‚Äî kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
text: vestigingsnummer string representing establishment number profile requested. geoData logical value indicating whether geo-data included response. Defaults FALSE. TRUE, response include geo-data. test_environment logical value indicating whether use test environment (TRUE) production environment (FALSE). Defaults FALSE.

title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number ‚Äî kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
text: tibble containing retrieved establishment profile. geoData = TRUE, returned tibble also include geographical information.

title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number ‚Äî kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
text: function retrieves data KvK Vestigingsprofiel API. geoData = TRUE, geo-data (e.g., location data) included returned profile. Important: test_environment = TRUE, actual API key required. using test data KvK test environment.

title: Retrieve the Vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number ‚Äî kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Retrieve vestigingsprofiel for a given establishment number without geo-data vestigingsprofiel <- kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(vestigingsnummer = "000038509504")  # Retrieve vestigingsprofiel with geo-data vestigingsprofiel_geo <- kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(vestigingsnummer = "000038509504", geoData = TRUE)  # Retrieve vestigingsprofiel from the test environment vestigingsprofiel_test <- kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(vestigingsnummer = "000038509504", test_environment = TRUE) } # }

what: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) ‚Äî kvk_search
title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) ‚Äî kvk_search
text: function automatically paginates KvK API collect available results. Due API limitations, retrieves maximum 1,000 records. happens, warning displayed. test_environment = TRUE, switches KvK's test environment, using mock API key testing purposes.

title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) ‚Äî kvk_search
code: kvk_search(..., test_environment = FALSE)

title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) ‚Äî kvk_search
text: ... Named arguments passed API query (e.g., naam = "Koudum"). Available arguments can found https://developers.kvk.nl/documentation/zoeken-api#input. test_environment logical value. TRUE, uses test environment instead live API. Defaults FALSE.

title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) ‚Äî kvk_search
text: tibble containing retrieved results. Possible parameters can found Results section https://developers.kvk.nl/documentation/zoeken-api#output.

title: Retrieve all results from the KvK Search API (up to 1,000 results) ‚Äî kvk_search
code: koudum <- kvk_search(plaats = "Koudum") koudum #> # A tibble: 506 √ó 6 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam                     adres        type  links  #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>                    <list>       <chr> <list> #>  1 01036576  000007810083     Stichting Gemeenschapsc‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  2 60112891  000045511098     Corriente 't Kofjeh√∫ske  <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  3 92692966  000032358083     M. de Boer               <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  4 40005051  000021251479     Bogerman                 <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  5 30168016  000057781184     It F√ªgeln√™st             <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  6 58496505  000027833429     HFK Verhuur              <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #>  7 62724843  000031708129     De Klink Exploitatie B.‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #>  8 01123666  000040288196     Winterberging IJzendoorn <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #>  9 40001473  000000303062     De S√¢ndobbe              <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #> 10 01091668  000000678279     Multiservice Beheer en ‚Ä¶ <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #> # ‚Ñπ 496 more rows  rotterdam <- kvk_search(plaats = "Rotterdam") #> ! API response contains more than 1,000 results. Only the first 1,000 will be retrieved. rotterdam #> # A tibble: 1,000 √ó 6 #>    kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam                     adres        type  links  #>    <chr>     <chr>            <chr>                    <list>       <chr> <list> #>  1 24483298  000023336749     Klooster Afrikaander     <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  2 34360247  000022666397     UWV WERKbedrijf Rotterd‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  3 24483298  000022493352     Gemeentewerken Rotterda‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  4 30019112  000022201726     Albron Campus Catering   <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  5 41126601  000023151153     Albert Schweitzer Groep‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  6 24335233  000010150471     Shop Rosie               <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  7 24483298  000022962077     GGD Rotterdam-Rijnmond   <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #>  8 55999271  000025728989     Ouderfonds o.b.s. what: Set KvK API Key for the current session ‚Äî kvk_set_api_key
title: Set KvK API Key for the current session ‚Äî kvk_set_api_key
text: function sets specified KvK API key current R session using Sys.setenv(). key available session ends.

title: Set KvK API Key for the current session ‚Äî kvk_set_api_key
code: kvk_set_api_key(api_key)

title: Set KvK API Key for the current session ‚Äî kvk_set_api_key
text: api_key string containing API key.

title: Set KvK API Key for the current session ‚Äî kvk_set_api_key
text: Invisibly returns TRUE key set.

title: Set KvK API Key for the current session ‚Äî kvk_set_api_key
text: function sets API key using Sys.setenv(), making available current session. However, persist across sessions. want store key permanently, use kvk_store_api_key().

title: Set KvK API Key for the current session ‚Äî kvk_set_api_key
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Set the API key for the current session kvk_set_api_key("abcd1234") } # }

what: Store KvK API Key in .Renviron for persistent use ‚Äî kvk_store_api_key
title: Store KvK API Key in .Renviron for persistent use ‚Äî kvk_store_api_key
text: function saves specified KvK API key .Renviron file, making persist across R sessions. API key already stored, must set overwrite = TRUE replace .

title: Store KvK API Key in .Renviron for persistent use ‚Äî kvk_store_api_key
code: kvk_store_api_key(api_key, overwrite = FALSE)

title: Store KvK API Key in .Renviron for persistent use ‚Äî kvk_store_api_key
text: api_key string containing API key. overwrite logical value indicating whether overwrite existing API key entry .Renviron. Defaults FALSE.

title: Store KvK API Key in .Renviron for persistent use ‚Äî kvk_store_api_key
text: Invisibly returns TRUE key added updated.

title: Store KvK API Key in .Renviron for persistent use ‚Äî kvk_store_api_key
text: function modifies .Renviron store API key permanently. key exists overwrite = FALSE, returns error. key exists overwrite = TRUE, replaces existing key. key exist, appends new API key entry .Renviron. Important: must restart R changes take effect.

title: Store KvK API Key in .Renviron for persistent use ‚Äî kvk_store_api_key
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Store the API key persistently kvk_store_api_key("abcd1234")  # Overwrite an existing API key kvk_store_api_key("newkey5678", overwrite = TRUE) } # }

what: kvkapiR: An R Wrapper for the Dutch Chamber of Commerce API ‚Äî kvkapiR-package
title: kvkapiR: An R Wrapper for the Dutch Chamber of Commerce API ‚Äî kvkapiR-package
text: Provides convenient interface Dutch Chamber Commerce (KvK) API. package built using `httr2` package follows best practices wrapping APIs R, outlined httr2 documentation (https://httr2.r-lib.org/articles/wrapping-apis.html). simplifies authentication, request handling, response parsing interacting KvK API.

title: kvkapiR: An R Wrapper for the Dutch Chamber of Commerce API ‚Äî kvkapiR-package
text: Maintainer: Coen Eisma coeneisma@gmail.com (ORCID)

what: Convert a nested list to a tibble ‚Äî list_to_tibble
title: Convert a nested list to a tibble ‚Äî list_to_tibble
text: function takes nested list converts tibble. element list becomes separate column tibble. nested list contains atomic elements equal length, transformed tibble. Otherwise, stored list-column.

title: Convert a nested list to a tibble ‚Äî list_to_tibble
code: list_to_tibble(lst)

title: Convert a nested list to a tibble ‚Äî list_to_tibble
text: lst named list converted tibble.

title: Convert a nested list to a tibble ‚Äî list_to_tibble
text: tibble element list represented column. Nested lists uniform atomic elements converted tibbles, lists stored list-columns.

title: Convert a nested list to a tibble ‚Äî list_to_tibble
code: sample_list <- list(   id = "12345",   name = "Test Company",   employees = 10,   addresses = list(     list(street = "Main St", number = 1),     list(street = "Second St", number = 2)   ) ) list_to_tibble(sample_list) #> Error in list_to_tibble(sample_list): could not find function "list_to_tibble"

title: kvkapiR (development version)
text: Initial setup package. pkgdown site genereated custom KvK color scheme. Added multiple examples vignette("kvkapiR")
